Name: David D
Title: The place where Gandhi was cremated after his assassination.
Review: This is a memorial place dedicated to the memory of Gandhi. An eternal flame burns beside a cenotaph. There are well kept gardens in the area, and there are many flowers. The entrance is free, but there is security to pass through. Many schoolchildren visit here to help them learn about Gandhi. Definitely worth a visit, but not a place to spend a lot of time unless you wish to sit and ponder the life of Gandhi.

Name: Gustavo A
Title: Calm, relaxing, Gandhi
Review: The Raj Ghat is not a big fancy attraction, for instance, as the Taj Mahal. It's a quiet place of calm and humility, very symbolic of how Gandhi lived. This is where his remains are and people come to pay their respects to essentially the father of the nation. It's a large compound of grass, bush and few trees all very well-kept. It's mostly empty compared to other places you can visit in Delhi, and security is constant. As you walk to the center, there are inscriptions of Gandhi's sayings on the walls of the pavement and in the middle is the main square where the tomb is. This main zone has to be crossed barefoot (with socks) and I don't think there's shoe covers available (at least when we went there). Still, this place is very much worth the visit, specially if you want a place to relax and get away from the chaos that is Delhi.

Name: Something Tookish
Title: A simple well maintain memorial
Review: Though it is a large memorial, it is a very simple memorial. A wall encircles  a grassy field with a rectangular marker in the middle. You need to remove your shoes before entering and you can't carry your shoes unless in a backpack or such.

Name: Woodstag
Title: Nice Memorial
Review: This is a very well maintained memorial garden dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi which is worth a visit because it has nice maintained grounds and location for some of his ashes - better value in visiting the Gandhi Smitri in New Delhi which is his last residence where he was assassinated and a museum

Name: NVKOnTheGo
Title: Best watched on TV
Review: The place is very well maintained. We went just before Gandhi Jayanthi and so were barred from entering as they were beautifying the approach with flower beds for the Presidential visit. Truck full of flower pots had come to the venue for the decor. So we went again 2 days after Gandhi Jayanthi and could see the drying flower decorations. The lawns are always very well maintained and spending on the flower beds for just one day could have been avoided. Footwear needs to be removed and the Delhi heat can burn your foot! Dont forget to shop on the street opposite the entrance for trinkets at a good price.

Name: Sudesh
Title: Nothing much if you are not a fan
Review: Place locate, this is beautiful but nothing much if you are not a fan of grate Gandhi. Avoid mid day time for burning sun. 1 hour is enough.

Name: Rob Nesbit
Title: rubbish.
Review: Raj Ghat is a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in Delhi, India. It is where some of his ashes and marks the exact location where Gandhi was consigned to flames and his last rites were performed, or so I read.Very disappointing memorial to such a great leader and man....Nice area and walk around, but the memorial is a bit simple (perhaps he would have liked that?), but I was expecting a little bit more......The sayings of the great man line the entrance, but its all some of his more straightforward quotes, nothing particular deep, perhaps they are lost in translation.Just spent about ten minutes here, had a look......and that was that....Didn't learn anything or seen anything amazing......There is a museum dedicated to Gandhi, but that is only noticeable after you leave the car park and are on the way home...........pointless.I guess its something one has to see, but to be honest it was Raj Ghat is a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in Delhi, India. it is where some of his ashes and marks the exact location where Gandhi was consigned to flames and his last rites were performed, or so I read.Very disappointing memorial to such a great leader and man....Nice area and walk around, but the memorial is a bit simple (perhaps he would have liked that?), but I was expecting a little bit more......The sayings of the great man line the entrance, but its all some of his more straightforward quotes, nothing particular deep, perhaps they are lost in translation.Just spent about ten minutes here, had a look......and that was that....Didn't learn anything or seen anything amazing......There is a museum dedicated to Gandhi, but that is only noticeable after you leave the car park and are on the way home...........pointless.I guess its something one has to see, but to be honest it was rubbish.

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Calm and Peaceful
Review: There is a black marble platform which marks the final resting place of Mahatma Gandhi and there is an eternal flame. The area is very clean and well maintained, lots of greenery around.

Name: Bidule05
Title: Isabelle (France)
Review: The Raj Ghat is the final resting place of the Mahatma Gandhi, who is one of the most respected Indian rulers, one of the most respected rulers of all times.At the entrance of the Raj Ghat, we had to take off our shoesWe walked on a paved path in a peaceful garden to go to the beautiful monument of black marble, bearing the inscription "He Ram". These words mean "O my God", and have been told by the Mahatma Gandhi before his last breath.Behind the monument, we saw a perpetual flame burning, which represents the eternity of the Mahatma Gandhi.I highly recommend to visit the Raj Ghat!!! I found that is a haven of peace, simplicity and serenity, represents perfectly the spirit of this great peace-loving man.

Name: Ama
Title: A restful place to go
Review: Mother & Daughter holiday Feb 2020We packed a lot in to our first day in Delhi, probably too much but it would have felt wrong to have not come here. Was a short time of tranquility in and felt appropriate to feel the ground with my feet within the memorial area.

Name: annewillsau
Title: Mahatma Ghandi memorial
Review: My tour group visited this memorial as part of our India tour in January 2020.  The memorial has detailed photos and stories about Ghandi's life and activism.  I also saw where Ghandi slept and where his body was laid out after his killing.

Name: SRKTB
Title: Memorial
Review: located between ring road & banks of Yamuna river. simple square platform of black marble marks the spot where Gandhi was cremated

Name: Vicky_The_explorer
Title: Mahatma Gandhi - Raghat
Review: Rajghat is a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in Delhi, IndiaOn his birthday today -2nd Oct we remember his golden words.."Be the Change you want to See"Visit the place for Tranquility and pay your respects to the beloved leader

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: TRIBUTE TO GANDHIJI
Review: Rajghat is located in Delhi and dedicated to the father of the nation Mahatma gandhi.It is located on the bank of river Yamuna.Its nearest metro station is Pragati maidan.It is a black marble platform that is built at the spot of cremation of Mahatma gandhi.

Name: Anjan Sengupta
Title: Peaceful
Review: This s the place where Mahatma Gandhi was laid to rest after his assassination. This is very quite and peaceful place and a must visit if you are in Delhi.

Name: sanjayvora45
Title: Memorial of Bapu
Review: This is the place where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated.Built with black marble and eternal flame is placed atop. "Samadhi' is surrounded by well maintained garden.Area is big yet simple and peaceful.

Name: Debashis T
Title: Peaceful Place
Review: Located on the banks of Yamuna River, Rajghat is the burial place of Mahatma Gandhi.Opens throughout the year from morning to evening, no entry fee is required.But you have to left your footwear at a distance before paying your homage. The memorial is in a black stone platform with flames burning through out the year. Surrounding the platform is a beautiful garden.

Name: Skeney57
Title: A Nice Tribute to the Great Soul
Review: A nice garden area dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi (Great Soul) who was cremated here after his 1948 assassination . A Great humanitarian who preached non violence as India's path to self governance granted in 1947 by the British. His glasses & profile are used widely in India still to today !

Name: Smokey128
Title: Quiet oasis
Review: The Gardens and the place marking the spot of Mahatma Gandhi’s cremation are an absolute oasis in the manic city that is Delhi. The gardens are beautifully kept and peaceful. Thought provoking verses of Gandhi’s are scattered all around the gardens so it makes it a place of contemplation and reflection. You are not allowed to wear shoes in most places in India so always carry a thick pair of socks.

Name: R1chardN
Title: Thought provoking but overshadowed by Gandi Smriti
Review: This is where Mohatma Gandi was cremated.  It is a peaceful and thought provoking resting place and we had read that it recognises his achievements and has a number of his quotes.  The cremation sight reflects his very simple life.We did not go beyond the gates as the previous day we had visited Gandi Smriti which is where he spent his final days before his assassination.  This had been such a good experience we did not want to take away from it.

Name: DP1066
Title: Peaceful and thought provoking!
Review: This is the spot where Mahatma Ghandi was cremated following his assassination in 1948.  The park is tranquil and peaceful.  Quotations by Ghandi are displayed alongside the path to the viewpoint  overlooking the memorial.

Name: MamaT23
Title: Peaceful
Review: Taking a leisurely walk in a garden atmosphere in the heart of Delhi is magnificent. Gandhi's cremation area is very simple with lots of colorful flowers and greenery all around. They have put monuments of his savings along the walk  THAT'S IT. No need for a long time here.

Name: Russell
Title: Peaceful and Worth a Visit.
Review: My wife and I visited the Ghandi Memorial as part of a Golden Triangle tour with the TripaDeal group in February. Fortunately, we visited the day after Donald Trump visited, so the memorial was in it's pristine best condition. It was peaceful, clean and not too busy when we were there. Well worth a visit.

Name: Broshi
Title: Nice historic place, no information or things to see
Review: The place is very nice. I have expected to see some information about the history of the site and maybe some illustrations. Entry is free.

Name: Travel_Revival
Title: Simple & Sublime
Review: This is where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated and the monument to him is simple, in keeping with the way he lived his life, yet more than the great man would have ever wanted for himself. Open, peaceful and exceptionally maintained, it is a place to reflect on his life and contribution to the creation of the independence of India and her people.

Name: SusannaW799
Title: You cannot visit Delhi without visiting this place.
Review: The black square of marble is the place where Gandhi was cremated a simple but strong monument which perhaps resembles the great man's life. I particularly liked the stones carved with some of his sayings, which ring so true - even in today's very different world.

Name: Philip_Marsh
Title: Memorial Garden Celebrating the Life of Mahatma Gandhi
Review: A visit to Delhi wouldn’t be complete without learning more about Gandhi. Whilst he was cremated and his ashes scattered in the river in Nepal this park was converted into a memorial for him.The park is separated from a square memorial garden, with eternal flame, by a large bank that you can walk up.If you wish to enter the garden then remove your shoes (officially you aren’t allowed to wear foot covers but we saw people wearing them) and leave your shoes with the attendants (who look after them for IRS1 per person - but they don’t carry change so it’ll cost you the smallest denomination that you carry). It’s then a small walk, in a pleasant garden, to view flower arrangements and an eternal flame. It’s pleasant enough but, all told, you’ll probably be finished within 30 minutes.

Name: Lawrence V
Title: A Must See Monument to a Great Man
Review: If you believe Gandhi was an incredible person, it is a humbling place to vist.  The grounds and the monument area are simple, peaceful and beautiful.  A perfect description of this complex, heroic man.Set in a large park where Gandhi was creamated is the memorial.  There is a overlook and steps down to the main level.  Shoes are not permitted, so make sure you have socks if you want to walk down to the site.Many plaques with Gandhi sayings are highlighted throuought the memorial.

Name: Gidons51
Title: Very nice memorial site for Mahatma Gandhi
Review: This are very nice gardens in a big park , to memorize Mahatma Gandhi , that was cremated here after his assassination. A very important place in memory of the father of the Indian people

Name: JP F
Title: Peaceful.. Gandhi
Review: This is a place not to miss.  Beautiful and clean memorial to Gandhi.  Beautiful gardens and flowers.  A place to remember along with Mother Teresa the beautiful love of India

Name: SalimM
Title: Memorial
Review: This is a memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. Set in a large park which also has memorials of Prime Ministers and other leaders of the country. Visitors flock to the Gandhi memorial which is a large rectangular black stone with a burning flame inside a casket. The black stone represents the spot where the cremation took place. You are required to take of your shoes before entering the memorial.

Name: Stephen C
Title: A very tasteful and suitable monument to a great man
Review: A wonderfully simple yet significant monument to the great man.  Stone plaques with engraved Ghandi sayings are to the side of the paths.  The lovely gardens surrounding the actual monument are carefully tended and the monument itself is not elaborate but seems to fit the character of the man.  Worth seeing.

Name: SKC04
Title: Peaceful
Review: Visited Raj Ghat and can not express in words how we felt walking up to the resting place of the great man. Peaceful resting place for the founder of India.

Name: S.Bajpai
Title: Delhi Tour
Review: Waste of land, nothing to see, it could be a good park.no sightseeing, just a simple place. Leave for politician.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Historical Value
Review: Well maintained and you will find peace and solace...Father of the Nation rests here. Visit with small children and family recommended. Children will get a historical perspective of the great leaders of the nation.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Serene atmosphere
Review: Remembered the Father of the Nation. Divine ambience. Well maintained premises. Must visit with family.

Name: TBSMKS
Title: Peaceful
Review: This is a monument to Mahatma Gandhi erected on the site of his funeral pyre. There is an eternal flame. Many people make pilgrimage here. It was very well maintained. It’s a very peaceful site. There were a lot of children/teachers there when we visited.

Name: Cedric N
Title: The cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi
Review: Had visited this open air memorial site in New Delhi a long back ago. This memorial site is a popular tourist attraction and is visited by tourists.This memorial site is located in Daryaganj area. There is a black marble platform which marks the spot where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated. However, there is an eternal flame burning in one end. It holds a great significance of the history of India. There is a stone footpath flanked by lawns leading to the walled enclosure that houses the memorial site. These lawns have fountains fitted in them. One can visit the memorial site of Jawaharlal Nehru called as Shantivan located close by. Had admired the garden as well as the black marble platform having the burning eternal flame. Also, had read the smaller inscriptions nearby in the dark as a school going child.This memorial site is an ideal place for families, school children as well as dignitaries. It is a must visit and should not be missed when in New Delhi.

Name: Sam M
Title: Interesting but not enlightening
Review: On our brief stopover in New Delhi was visited Raj Ghat the site where Gandhi was creamated. There were no guides so we tagged along with another tour group and listened in.Getting into the park was interesting as you had to leave your shoes behind and they were actuallythere when we left the park.Overall an interesting.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Gandhi funeral spot
Review: The Raj Ghat is a memorial park that is both a park and a memorial for notable Indian leaders. The most famous of all the memorial is probably the one to Gandhi. The memorial is on the lower level of a mound. The mound is essentially a platform from which to view the memorial below, which is a large marble platform to commemorate the sport where the great man was cremated. The lower level is accessible to the public, although you do need to remove your shoes to enter. The marble platform is garlanded with flowers and next to it is an eternal flame.The Raj Ghat is not the most amazing thing you’ll see in Delhi, but I could not visit the city without paying my respects to the great man and stand at the spot where he was cremated.

Name: Sunil
Title: Gandhi funeral place
Review: The raj ghat is famous for Gandhi's funeral palace.wher many people visits across location comes here to see this place.One of a kind experience to me.the place is well maintained and clean.

Name: Sounak Poddar
Title: Royal
Review: Raj Ghat timings are from 6:30 am in the morning to 6:00 pm in the evening. It is open on all days of the week. On every Friday of the week, a special prayer meet is conducted at the Raj Ghat at 5.30 PM. there is no entry fee as well either for the general public or for the foreigners.

Name: Venusbeachreturners
Title: Lovely Tribute
Review: Visitors to New Delhi should endeavour to visit this peaceful and tranquil memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. The fresh flowers on the slab of marble looked lovely.

Name: mgc6754
Title: Peaceful as you would expect
Review: This is by comparison to other sites, a very simple serene place to visit.   It is beautifully maintained and very 'ordered'.  A place to think and reflect, certainly a little oasis of calm in a busy day of sightseeing.

Name: w0rldtraveller2015
Title: Worth a visit to pay tribute to Father of Nation
Review: When in Delhi, please spare some time to visit Raj Ghat and pay tribute to Mahatma Gandhi. We all should be thankful for his selfless contribution to the nation as well as his ideologies that the world has imbibed. This is a simple memorial and sticks to basics   as the man himself was. Worth a visit.

Name: Alice L
Title: Simple and peaceful
Review: The site is big and very well maintained with paved paths in the garden and along the wall above ground. Walking around the site is pleasant and peaceful. The memorial is a simple marble platform and is decorated with fresh flowers.

Name: Sheela2011
Title: Interesting place to visit
Review: This is interesting from the political point of view as it contains memorials to great leaders like Mahatma Gandhi and Indira Gandhi.Tranquil gardens.

Name: CleopatraLuxor
Title: Beautiful memorial garden
Review: We visted Rajghat on the recommendation of our tuk tuk driver. Very peaceful and unassuming, plaques full of Mahatma Gandhi's words of wisdom dotted around the gardens. Free to get in and worthwhile as it is a humbling experience.

Name: Madalyn H
Title: Great site
Review: Very peaceful garden and memorial which represents the site of Gandhi's cremation. Very well maintained.

Name: jazsacher
Title: worth a quick stop
Review: We stopped and walked around for less than an hour.  This is a lovely, clean, modern memorial which is aesthetic and appealing to walk around.  However, with all the other memorials, parks, and museums in town I wouldn't spend too much time here.  It's simple and not too much to look at given how big the park/memorial is.  I wouldn't spend more than 1 hour here but that's just my opinion.

Name: ashishdeora123
Title: good
Review: Raj Ghat in Delhi is an important landmark for India as it is a memorial to the father of our nation, Mahatma Gandhi The entry to the site is completely free. It is open from 05:00 am to 07:30 pm on all days.

Name: 188petere
Title: A quiet spiritual place toexplore - would have liked a bit more time
Review: In the chaos of Delhi, the Raj Ghat is peaceful, green and a place to explore & soak up the atmosphere of the park.Reached by a short walk after being processed by security, you can look at the monument on the spot where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated, either from the top walk which goes around the square, or at ground level when you can get closer to the monument & story boards.There is a large park with lots of various bird types and gardens to enjoy if you have the time.

Name: Dan L
Title: Dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi
Review: The memorial is formed from black marble and stands on the spot where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated following his assassination in 1948. An eternal flame is located atop the marble slab. The memorial is surrounded by well manicured gardens within a walled enclosure. The park contains various trees that were planted by visiting dignitaries and heads of state. Worth the visit to experience a little of the mystique of the man.Parking area across the road with a restaurant, souvenir shop and toilets. There is also a sculpture of the Mahatma shown wearing the traditional dhoti and shawl with book held in the left hand and his right holding a staff.

Name: ling1931
Title: Peaceful
Review: Set in peaceful and well maintain gardens this memorial site where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated after assassination in 1948 is certainly worth a visit.As you pass though the gate there are several quotations on plaque's of Gandhi's sayings which are worth a few minutes of your time to read,as you walk to the memorial stone you have a choice of two paths one leads you to the memorial stone the other to a area over looking the site,shoe's must be removed if you if you decide to walk around the memorial stone.

Name: Ansari Iqbal
Title: Raj Ghat
Review: The cremation of Mahatma Gandhi took place at the Raj Ghat on 31st January 1948, a day after his assassination. The memorial was designed by Vanu G. Bhuta, who intended it to reflect the simplicity of the Mahatma's life. It has won several awards for its architectural design. The memorial stone of Mahatma Gandhi placed on a simple square platform made of black stone, with the words Hey Ram inscribed on it. It is left open to the sky while an eternal flame burns perpetually at one end. The road on which it is located is also known as the Mahatma Gandhi Road. It is situated amidst a well maintained garden with fountains and numerous trees that give the area a serene atmosphere. Near the memorial, there are labeled trees planted by visiting dignitaries such as Queen Elizabeth II, Ho Chi Minh, the former Australian Prime Minister Gough Whitman and the former US president Dwight Eisenhower. Around the sides of the garden are quotes and thoughts written by Gandhi, engraved in different languages. All guests must remove their footwear before entering the Raj Ghat walls. To the north of the Raj Ghat is the cremation site of Jawaharlal Nehru known as the Shanti Van. Opposite to Raj Ghat is the Gandhi National Museum which contains some of Gandhi's belongings.

Name: dshan2016
Title: A Must See : Peaceful Place to Visit in Delhi
Review: It is a memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. Very beautiful and well maintained garden. Free entry. It is on the road. Auto Riksha will take maximum 100rs from New Delhi Station. Huge build up area.

Name: andy S
Title: well looked after
Review: free entry to peaceful, well kept memorial gardens, can stroll along the perimeter wall (shoes have to be taken off, can be left with staff at the entrance)

Name: Shobha
Title: Wanted to Show my kids
Review: I wanted to show this place to my kids . As they are huge fan of  Mahatma Gandhi . Entry fee is free . Overall experience was excellent.

Name: Peter I
Title: A tranquil place to visit
Review: Raj Ghat is the memorial site where Ghandi was cremated after his assassination. Its set in immaculately maintained gardens adjacent to the Ring Road. Bare feet or socks are mandatory. (some folks were using the flip flops from their hotel room. The actual memorial is a black marble slab decorated with marigold flowers with an Eternal Flame beside it. Its quite a simple tasteful memorial to the great man. There is little in the way of information except for a few well chosen sayings/statements of Ghandhi's dotted about, so read your guide book for more information. On Friday's there are commemorative prayers. Close by are other Ghandi related memorials/museums - across the road is the Gandhi Darshan displaying photos of his life; a short distance away memorials to Nehru, Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi and the National Gandhi museum, displaying Gandhi's personal belongings. There is parking, an ATM, toilets and a small cafe acros the road.

Name: Brown
Title: Resting place of an important person in India
Review: This area is so worth the walk with no shoes.  I got to see the resting place of such an important person from India's history. I prayed for his soul and thanked him for the goodness he did to India and what an inspirration he is until to this day.

Name: RSD78
Title: Easily accessible and well-maintained
Review: A simple, well-maintained site where Gandhi was cremated and a lovely tribute to the great man. Set in a nice quiet park, where food is not allowed in so there is no litter. Banked walls around the centre provide for views of the surroundings and an elevated view of the black marble memorial. It is a lovely place to escape from the business of Delhi for a short while and reflect on some of Gandhi's wisdom and teaching. Close by to the Smriti (his home at the end and where he was shot) to be able to both together easily. Easy parking for your tuk-tuk/taxi over the road from the entrance , where there is also a pleasant, cheap cafe and an ATM (albeit there was no cash in the machine when we were there).

Name: Dennis N
Title: Peace and quiet
Review: A beautiful quiet area to walk and admire the park landscaping. It's well kept as it's a memorial for Gandhi. Suitable for taking landscape and flower photos.The right place for some peaceful stroll.

Name: Rocky
Title: Rip Mahatma Gandhi ji
Review: Raj ghat is memorable place of Mahatma Gandhi ji. He is the father of nation of India.He was a Great man.

Name: Dave G
Title: A green oasis in Delhi
Review: After a morning of crazy streets, noise, congestion and pollution in the streets of Delhi it was a delight to spend an hour in a well tended greenery with birdsong, tree shade and floral beauty. The eternal flame at the site of Gandhi’s cremation was moving. It was amusing to note the names on the plaques at the base of the memorial trees- planted by such champions of world peace as Hồ Chí Minh, Nicolae Ceaușescu and Marshal Tito! A very enjoyable chance to relax and breathe in the heart of Delhi!

Name: Robin
Title: Dedicated to the Father of Nation
Review: Raj Ghat is the memorial of  our father of Nation – Mahatma GandhiIt is a Beautiful Garden with greenery all around

Name: nasus1201
Title: Tribute to a world leader
Review: The grounds surrounding Gandhi's cremation site are lovely and spacious.  The monument itself with its simple austerity is an honor to the way he lived his life.

Name: NauticalDreamer3010
Title: very interesting
Review: Although the grounds are very pleasant, being the cremation site of the assassinated Mahatma to admirers and history buffs this is more of a pilgrimage. I for one am truely glad we visited.

Name: vagabondginger
Title: Mahatma Means "Great Soul"
Review: Gandhi was called the Father of India as he worked for their independence, so this is a respectful and honored place. HIs cremation here released his soul and it is said his ashes did make it to the holy Ganges River. The black slab with the eternal flame is a memorial set in a beautifully landscaped park.

Name: A R Kohli
Title: Beautiful and peaceful environment
Review: Dedicated to Father of Nation Mahatma Gandhiji who was cremated here. The whole place is full of flowers and very well maintained and manicured lawns. One can pay homage and enjoy lovely peaceful surroundings.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: cazhgs
Title: Very emotional
Review: This area is so worth a walk, it is very emotional seeing the resting place of such an important person from India's history.

Name: Alon R
Title: beautiful and calm monument for a great leader
Review: beautiful and calm monument for a great leader, full with lovely gardens, respect memorial tomb filled with fresh flowers around it

Name: hanc66
Title: Beautiful
Review: This is a beautiful peaceful place, I visited as part of a group tour. I found it very moving to be in such an important historical place honouring an inspirational human being.

Name: Ishuarav
Title: Raj Ghat
Review: Raj Ghat is a memorial dedicated to mahatma Gandhi.The memorial is beautifully decorated with flowers,with a lamp and a beautiful bhajan at the background-truly a tribute to Mahatma.There are other memorials too inside. But no proper sign boards or directions.shakti sthal and veer Bhumi is at walkable distance. Other memorials are not  directed with proper sign boards and the place is aloof.Veer Bhoomi and shakti sthal lacks even basic decorations though it attracts thousands of visitors every day.Parking and entry is free.

Name: Anupam Verma
Title: Respect
Review: I am sure there are great reviews already available about the place that provide enough details. I will just add a couple of points - 1. I know there's an entire museum dedicated to the great leader not far from here, but some additional write-up/ videos/ displays would help tourists, especially those coming from outside India. 2. Some other leaders' samadhis are housed within the same area, but I wish there were clear directions with distances mentioned at the signboards so getting around is easy for tourists.

Name: JnVSydney
Title: A sombre experience
Review: Visiting the place where Gandhi was cremated was a sombre experience, now surrounded by, green gardens, and a viewing point, everybody, was quite and orderly, respectful to the great man.

Name: Sharon J
Title: Tribute to Ghandi
Review: This was memorable and moving. Our guide was brilliant. We went to see the eternal flame and pay our respects.Shoes had to be removed again, however I put then in my bag this time

Name: Ian M
Title: peaceful
Review: This memorial to Ghandi is peaceful. A large expanse of lawn and some beautiful gardens.  Not a lot to see but worth the time once you get through the security.

Name: Bossman43
Title: Visit to Gandhi’s Memorial
Review: A little bit of peace in the bustling intensity of Delhi. Simple garden to walk around (after you have been through airport style security and bag scans). Then, after taking off your shoes (you can leave them for free or pay a small fee for them to be looked after), you can go into the smaller central area to see the black marble platform marking the spot where Gandhi’s was cremated and the eternal flame...the garden has a number of Gandhi’s quotes dotted around it....

Name: PrimeTimeV
Title: Beautiful Gardens
Review: This is the memorial to Gandhi set in some lovely gardens.  There really is not much to see here other than gardens and a lawn.

Name: BrigitteAttard
Title: Peace
Review: A fitting peaceful memorial to a beacon of light to the world.  I felt privileged to have visited this beautifully maintained garden, and felt the aura of peace this great man emanated through his fight for human rights through non-violence.

Name: Steve D
Title: Pretty memorial garden
Review: The Raj Ghat memorial to Gandhi is part of a complex including the memorials of Nehru and Indira Gandhi.The flame is eternal surrounded by lovely lawns.

Name: 257zoe
Title: Beautiful gardens
Review: I went to India this March doing a mercury holidays tour this was the stop on the way back to the hotel after seeing the red fort, it was beautiful the gardens and memorial. We spent about half an hour here

Name: Fiona1110
Title: Not really much to see or do.
Review: This is the place Ghandi was cremated the day after he was assassinated. You can take your shoes off  and go to the lower level, or leave them on and walk around the top.There is basically only a garden, a black slab and an eternal flame. Not really worth the visit.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: important place for Indians
Review: It is the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi who is the father of the nation.We can see all the quotes of Mahatma Gandhi over here.nice surroundings and peaceful.

Name: Ashley P
Title: Beautiful garden and memorial
Review: Lovely and well kept garden for the memorial of Gandhi, in the heart of Delhi but very peaceful, and good tile to relax and think in the middle of a busy town

Name: PedroJoven
Title: Memorial of India's great man
Review: Nice memorial site with beautiful gardens. Relaxing to walk around but for best experience, one will need a tour guide. Wish they have a pamphlet to guide tourists.

Name: PipPaul W
Title: Simplicity
Review: This is a simple monument for a great manThe monument looks well looked after and is within a raised walkway which Shields it from the worse of the Delhi bedlam beyondThere is shoe storage at the entrance for 1 - yes one - rupee, but there are free cubicles opposite

Name: Woody16
Title: Beautiful memorial.....
Review: Our great guide explained everything that had happened to this great man and then to visit the area where he was cremated was an honour. Even though it was very busy everyone showed great respect and it was all very quiet around the flame. The gardens were lovely too.

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: Memorial
Review: This is one of the best place in Delhi. Very nice and very well maintained place. You can spend your whole evening in this place. Best to visit in winter. No food joints inside. Security is very tight also. very clean place.

Name: Middlemiss
Title: It's the place of a memorable cremation
Review: Mahatma Gandhi's funeral pyre after his assassination in 1948. It is beautifully preserved as a modern garden. It is clearly a place of pilgrimage for many. So much history that we British have much to answer for.

Name: Linda Y
Title: Mahatma Gandhi Memorial
Review: The focus of this open-air memorial to Mahatma Gandhi is a black marble platform marking the place where the peace leader was cremated after his assassination on Jan 30, 1948. I visited on Jan 31, the day after India celebrates Martyrs' Day, and Gandhi’s memorial was covered in flowers. Gandhi Smriti, a museum dedicated to his life, is much more informative. If short on time, go there instead.

Name: Andrew S
Title: Great Political Significance
Review: The key aspect of this memorial is the great significance of Mahatma Gandhi.  You would not expect it to be very exciting, rather a very calm and peaceful site, as it should be.  It is decently quiet, and does not shout politics or preach indfependance.

Name: One_of_the_BOFs
Title: Serene memorial to the great man
Review: This was the last major attraction that we visited in our three night stay in Delhi, a great way to finish our two week adventure in India. A simple but very appropriate & fitting memorial to this great man, serene and tranquil, which enables you to feel far away from the city hubbub outside.There are some very interesting names from history on the plaques by the trees planted by visiting dignitaries.

Name: Margaret G
Title: A green space to reflect in
Review: In such a busy city it is amazing to go to such a 'modern' green space that is an oasis of calm. We walked through this memorium to Gandhi and it was lovely to see the reverence with which he was held and it was a privilege to see the flowers being changed. We were there before 10am when the shoe storage was open but it was lovely to be there when not busy. A beautiful place with lots of colours.

Name: ValK033
Title: Beautiful memorial garden
Review: This is a beautiful memorial garden dedicated to the memory of Mahatma Gandhi. Take time to wander around and enjoy the famous sayings. It is well worth a visit.

Name: Jayne J
Title: A FITTING TRIBUTE TO A MONUMENTAL MAN
Review: Raj Ghat is the memorial to The Father of India, Mahatma Ghandi. His ashes lay there in a beautiful park land setting, befitting this great man. It is very popular for the local to come and pay tribute as well as a priveledge for foreign visitors. Look out for plaques with meaningful sayings.

Name: Colin B
Title: Impressive
Review: Our tour stopped here, and it was well worth seeing.  The area is very well laid out, and it is nice to read the famous sayings from Ghandi around the area.

Name: mumsview
Title: Peaceful garden setting
Review: Memorial to Gandhi. Cremation site has been developed into the most beautiful garden memorial with everlasting flame. Need to remove shoes and put in locker for small fee. Photos allowed.

Name: Dashers2014
Title: Surreal!
Review: A great way to celebrate the life of a humble, modest great man. Clean, very simple - like him - free to enter. Lovely place to walk.

Name: Nikko4Me
Title: A Must See during a visit to Delhi area!!!!
Review: Wow!, definitely a must see while in Delhi.  Raj Ghat is a memorial dedicated to Gandhi, and it’s located in the place where he was cremated.The entire area is a park. You do need to go through a scanner to access the memorial.  There are ramps on either side which will give you access above the memorial.  When you enter the memorial, you leave your shoes at the counter (for a small tip), and then walk into the central courtyard where you can walk around the black marble memorial of Gandhi.  The quotes that are around the walkway are also very thought provoking!The music that is playing completes the experience!The one sad thing that I saw within a minute of being there was someone threw trash onto lawn, instead of putting it into the trash receptacle that was within 50 feet of the person!
